sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"区别，辨别"之意。
means: discern ： 语义较笼统，着重精深与准确的观察力，不一定有能分辨关系密切的各项事物的含义。
discriminate ： 语气强，指从十分相似的事物中辨出差异，尤其把好坏区分开来。
distinguish ： 普通用词，指辨别者的能力或实际观察到的区别，强调辨别所需的技巧。

sentence.Network_en: Below the bridge we could just discern a narrow, weedy ditch.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们仅能依稀辨出桥下一条杂草丛生的窄沟。

sentence.Network_en: It is possible to discern a number of different techniques in her work.
sentence.Network_cn: 从她的作品中可以识别出许多不同的创作手法。

sentence.Network_en: Some people find it difficult to discern blue from green.
sentence.Network_cn: 有些人很难分辨蓝色与绿色.

区分矩阵（Discernibility Matrix）是由波兰华沙大学的著名数学家skowron提出来的，是近年来在粗糙集约简上出现的一个有力工具。
简化差别矩阵,simplifie... ... ) simple binary discernibility matrix 简化的二进制差别矩阵 ) discernibility matrix 差别矩阵.
discernible foliation trend 可辨别叶理走向discernible image 可辨别的图象discernible 可辨别的

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: via Old French from Latin discernere, from dis- 'apart' + cernere 'to separate'

entry.def: If you can discern something, you are aware of it and know what it is.

example.ex: You need a long series of data to be able to discern such a trend...
example.tran: 你需要一长串的数据才能看出这一趋势。

example.ex: It was hard to discern why this was happening.
example.tran: 很难弄清楚这为什么会发生。

entry.def: If you can discern something, you can just see it, but not clearly.

example.ex: Below the bridge we could just discern a narrow, weedy ditch.
example.tran: 我们仅能依稀辨出桥下一条杂草丛生的窄沟。

sentences.sentence: "The fleeing convicts were picked out of the darkness by the watchful prison guards"
"I can't make out the faces in this photograph"

auth_sentence.content: Not categories, but the ability to discern categories.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Not categories, but the ability to discern categories.

auth_sentence.content: By now the original intention was hard to discern.
auth_sentence.res_content: By now the original intention was hard to discern.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: By now the original intention was hard to discern.

auth_sentence.content: The legacy of Ludlow is not easy to discern.
auth_sentence.res_content: The legacy of Ludlow is not easy to discern.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The legacy of Ludlow is not easy to discern.

stems_affixes.word_buile: concern[v.关系到 n.关心]+ed……的→adj.关心的, 有关的
discern[v.辨别;区分]+ible能……的→adj.能够分辨的
con共同+cern搞清,区别→共同搞清楚→关心
discern[v.辨别;区分]+ment表名词→n.辨别能力
con共同+cern搞清,区别→共同搞清楚→关心
dis分开+cern搞清,区别→分开搞清→区别

Sentence.sentence: In the real world, problems rarely come neatly packaged, so being able to discern their deep structure is key.

sentences.en: We discerned the figure of a man clinging to the mast of the wrecked ship.
sentences.cn: 我们看见一个人紧抱着破船的桅杆。

sentences.en: I soon discerned that the man was lying.
sentences.cn: 我很快便察觉出这个人是在撒谎。

jushi.english: He is unable to discern the shape of a horse in the mist.
jushi.chinese: 他不能看清雾中马的轮廓。

jushi.english: We discerned the figure of a man cling to the mast of the wrecked ship.
jushi.chinese: 我们看见一人紧抱着破船的桅杆。

jushi.english: He could discern a faint light at the end of the forest.
jushi.chinese: 他能看到在森林的尽头有一线微弱的灯光。
